Instruction: Combine the cornmeal, all-purpose flour, salt, and baking powder in a large bowl.
Mix the eggs, butter, and buttermilk in a separate bowl. Then, add this mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until well blended.
Preheat a 12-inch cast iron skillet over high heat for 2 minutes. Add corn oil, coat the skillet, and leave remaining oil. Return to high heat for 1 minute.
Cook the cornbread over high heat until bubbles form in the center, then remove from the stove.
Bake in a preheated 400-degree F (200-degree C) oven for 40 to 50 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean. Serve warm.
